column4: where does the PATH varible is set for the users, it is not /etc/profile or /etc/bashrc and the /etc/envirment file doesn't match, any idea ?
the user does not modify his path, and i can't find where it is set up
i dunno. should be /etc/bashrc if using bash.
i got nothing in /etc/profile.d and nothing in /etc/bashrc or /etc/bash.bashrc
sure the user have evrything but he doesn't modify the path (except adding ~/bin)
so you sure that all the user's ~/.bash* files don't have any other export PATH ?
i greped it, there is nothing else than the thing about the local bin

yeah, but the problem with greping just ~/.bash* is that the bash files themselves can source other files. if you try removing/renaming all the user's ~/.bash* files, and then have him 'su - <user_id>', and then "echo $PATH" he'll have nothing. that would prove that one of the ~/.bash* files are calling another file somewhere.
yep he get another path, i must check those startup scripts deeper
yeah. if using bash, the order is after login: call ~/.bash_profile -> ~/.bashrc. and ~/.bashrc sources stuff in /etc/bashrc. there's a lot of calls made in /etc/bashrc ...
sadly enougth it is /etc/bash_cpompletion that screw things up anyway thanks for your help
